questions.question: What is the term "cybersecurity landscape" commonly used to describe?

options.A: The evolving threats, technologies, and defenses in cybersecurity
options.B: Physical security measures in an office

questions.question: What is the term "cybersecurity landscape" commonly used to describe?

options.A: The evolving threats, technologies, and defenses in cybersecurity
options.B: Physical security measures in an office

questions.question: Which of the following is a major component of the cybersecurity landscape?

options.B: Cyber threats, including malware and phishing

questions.question: What is a key focus of the cybersecurity landscape?

options.C: Identifying and addressing digital threats and vulnerabilities

questions.question: Which term refers to a type of attack where hackers disrupt services by overwhelming a system with traffic?
What is the primary goal of cybersecurity?

options.B: To ensure hardware components are up-to-date
options.C: To monitor user behavior at work
options.D: To protect systems, networks, and data from unauthorized access or attacks

questions.question: What is one of the most common cybersecurity threats?
Which organization plays a key role in shaping the global cybersecurity landscape?
Which of the following is an example of a cybersecurity defense tool?
What does the term "threat actor" mean in the cybersecurity landscape?

options.A: An individual or group that poses a cybersecurity threat
options.D: A security feature in a browser

questions.question: What is one major factor influencing the modern cybersecurity landscape?

options.B: The rapid advancement of technology and interconnected devices

questions.question: What is a hardware vulnerability?

options.A: A flaw in software code that leads to security breaches
options.C: A weakness in physical components of a system that can be exploited

questions.question: What is a software vulnerability?

options.D: A weakness in software code that can be exploited by attackers

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a hardware vulnerability?

options.A: A CPU flaw that allows unauthorized access to memory
options.B: A bug in an application’s code

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a software vulnerability?

options.B: An unpatched operating system with known security flaws

questions.question: What can cause hardware vulnerabilities?

options.C: Poor manufacturing design or flaws in microchips

questions.question: What type of vulnerability is commonly targeted by malware such as ransomware?
What is the primary method to reduce software vulnerabilities?

options.C: Increasing the power supply to the device
options.D: Regularly applying security patches and updates

questions.question: What is a common attack that exploits hardware vulnerabilities?

options.C: Side-channel attacks that extract data from hardware devices

questions.question: What is the primary reason software vulnerabilities exist?

options.B: Errors or flaws in the programming code

questions.question: Which of the following can mitigate both hardware and software vulnerabilities?
What is a security vulnerability?

options.D: A weakness in a system that can be exploited by attackers

questions.question: What is an exploit in cybersecurity?

options.C: A method used by attackers to take advantage of a vulnerability

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a security vulnerability?

options.A: A system with updated antivirus protection

questions.question: What does a buffer overflow exploit target?

options.A: The memory of a system to execute unauthorized code
options.B: The power supply of a computer

questions.question: What is the purpose of a zero-day exploit?

options.A: To exploit a vulnerability before it is discovered or fixed
options.B: To patch a security vulnerability immediately
options.C: To test system performance under load
options.D: To monitor network activity for anomalies

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of cyber attacker?
What is the primary responsibility of a penetration tester?

options.B: To write malicious code for hackers
options.D: To test and strengthen system security by simulating attacks

questions.question: Which type of attacker uses pre-written tools or scripts without extensive technical knowledge?
What is the main goal of a black hat hacker?

options.B: To identify system vulnerabilities for malicious purposes

questions.question: Which of the following is a typical tool used by cybersecurity professionals?
Which of the following best defines organization data?

options.D: Data related to an organization’s operations, processes, and assets

questions.question: What is an example of organization data?

What is the purpose of securing organization data?

options.A: To protect the organization’s assets and reputation
options.B: To make it inaccessible to employees

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of intellectual property data for an organization?
What is a common threat to organization data?

options.C: Unauthorized access by external or internal actors
